publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1280# Elaine Smith: National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004-That the Parliament notes the vital role that National Breastfeeding Awareness Week, 9 to 15 May 2004, plays in the promotion and support of breastfeeding throughout the United Kingdom; congratulates those health sector workers, volunteers and mothers whose dedication and hard work have contributed to an increase in the uptake and duration rates of breastfeeding in Scotland in recent years, in particular, NHS Lanarkshire who, as one of the first NHS boards to devise a breastfeeding strategy in Scotland, has this week launched a comprehensive review to build on its previous work; accepts that continued support and investment is needed at a national level to move Scotland closer to the national breastfeeding target of 50% of mothers still breastfeeding their babies at six weeks of life by 2005; acknowledges the importance of empowering Scotland's people and communities to make better and healthier lifestyle choices, and considers that the Scottish Executive should do everything within its power to support, promote, protect and encourage breastfeeding mothers in the coming year. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1280# Elaine Smith: National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004-That the Parliament notes the vital role that National Breastfeeding Awareness Week, 9 to 15 May 2004, plays in the promotion and support of breastfeeding throughout the United Kingdom; congratulates those health sector workers, volunteers and mothers whose dedication and hard work have contributed to an increase in the uptake and duration rates of breastfeeding in Scotland in recent years, in particular, NHS Lanarkshire who, as one of the first NHS boards to devise a breastfeeding strategy in Scotland, has this week launched a comprehensive review to build on its previous work; accepts that continued support and investment is needed at a national level to move Scotland closer to the national breastfeeding target of 50% of mothers still breastfeeding their babies at six weeks of life by 2005; acknowledges the importance of empowering Scotland's people and communities to make better and healthier lifestyle choices, and considers that the Scottish Executive should do everything within its power to support, promote, protect and encourage breastfeeding mothers in the coming year. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Marlyn Glen*, Linda Fabiani*, Robin Harper*, Patrick Harvie*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Kate Maclean*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*, Carolyn Leckie*

S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Brian Adam*, Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Christine Grahame*, Margaret Jamieson*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Shona Robison*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Ms Sandra White*, Scott Barrie*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Dr Jean Turner*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Susan Deacon*, Irene Oldfather*, Rhona Brankin*, Karen Whitefield*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Cathie Craigie*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Pauline McNeill*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Helen Eadie*
S2M-1280# National Breastfeeding Awareness Week 2004 (lodged on 6 May 2004) Cathy Peattie*
